Key Match Events: Andrew Heaney pitched six-plus innings and allowed four runs, three earned, on three hits.
Marcus Semien hit his sixth leadoff home run of the season and 30th of his career.
Nathaniel Lowe hit a home run.
Ezequiel Duran hit his third home run of the season.
David Robertson left runners on the corners in the eighth with a one-run lead, but Kirby Yates earned his 29th save in 30 chances.
Caden Dana gave up five runs on seven hits, including three home runs, in just 11 batters.
Michael Stefanic’s sacrifice fly scored Matt Thaiss, pulling the Angels within 5-4 in the seventh.
Travis Jankowski’s two-out single in the eighth scored two unearned runs for Texas.
Post-Match Reflections: Andrew Heaney expressed happiness for the team’s support.
Ron Washington, the Angels manager, commented on Dana’s struggles.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Texas Rangers won three out of four games against the Angels, matching their best four consecutive series wins of the season.
The Rangers have climbed within four games of.500 for the first time since July 30.
